The 'Union for a Popular Movement' ( ; 'UMP' ) is a centre-right political party in France, being one of the two major
contemporary political parties in the country along with the centre-left
Socialist Party (PS). The UMP was formed in 2002 as a merger of several centre-
right parties under President Jacques Chirac.

The former leader of the UMP, Nicolas Sarkozy, was elected President of France
in the 2007 presidential election, but was defeated by Socialist FranÃ§ois
Hollande in a run-off five years later. The party enjoyed an absolute majority
in the National Assembly from 2002 to 2012. The UMP is a member of the European
People's Party (EPP), the Centrist Democrat International (CDI) and the
International Democrat Union (IDU).

Since November 2012 national congress the leader of the party is Jean-FranÃ§ois
CopÃ©, who narrowly beat FranÃ§ois Fillon (50.03% to 49.97% among party members). http://www.u-m-p.org/actualites/a-la-une/resultats-des-elections-
internes-79802011 Accusations of voter fraud led former Prime Minister
Francois Fillon to "precautionary seizure" of ballots cast "to protect them from
tampering or alteration". http://www.businessinsider.com/ump-leadership-
struggle-suicide-2012-11
